Herbal remedies: One potential solution for treating a common cold without medication is to rely on herbal remedies. Many herbs have natural antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties, such as eucalyptus, peppermint, and echinacea. These herbs can be consumed as teas, added to food, or taken in supplement form. For example, eucalyptus oil has been shown to have antiviral properties that can help reduce the severity of a cold.

Honey and lemon: Honey has antibacterial properties that can help soothe a sore throat, while lemon has natural antiviral properties that can help boost the immune system. Mixing honey and lemon in hot water or tea can provide relief from cold symptoms.

Ginger and turmeric: Ginger has anti-inflammatory properties that can help reduce a fever and alleviate congestion, while turmeric has natural antibacterial properties that can help fight off infections. Both can be consumed as teas or added to food.

Salt water gargle: Gargling with salt water can help reduce inflammation in the throat and relieve a sore throat. Mixing 1/4 teaspoon of salt in 8 ounces of warm water and gargling several times a day can provide relief from cold symptoms.

Aromatherapy: Certain essential oils, such as peppermint, eucalyptus, and lavender, have natural antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties that can help alleviate cold symptoms. These oils can be inhaled through steam inhalation or added to a diffuser to provide relief.
